H0.text: Stem is the part of a plant that makes sugar from carbon dioxide.

H1.text: Leaf is the part of a plant that makes sugar from carbon dioxide.

H2.text: Root is the part of a plant that makes sugar from carbon dioxide.

H3.text: Flower is the part of a plant that makes sugar from carbon dioxide.

A4.text: In C4 plants, carbon dioxide is fixed in the mesophyll cells of the leaf and transported to the bundle sheath cells.

A5.text: The light-independent reactions, which include the Calvin cycle, occur in the chloroplasts of plant cells.
